reviews.review_msg: Dr. Miao is very generous with both his grading scheme and giving tons of part marks. Exams are open book meaning your grade comes down to how well you are familiar with the material. Homework assignment do take a lot of time to complete. I found it difficult to understand Dr. Miao in lecture but his slides are very straightforwards.
assignments are heavy but fun. there's one coding assignment, no project.

Not sure why my review was taken down but Mr. Miao is a great professor and tries very hard. He cares a lot about his students and wants you to do well. Very kind grading scheme and high class average. Would highly recommend.

He clearly wants his students to do well and had a very kind grading scheme. Reasonable number of assignments and usually provided a program to check your answers for correctness. Recorded audio lectures. 3 midterms but dropped your worst. No final. Would definitely recommend!

Not sure why SFU decided to let him teach an upper division course, because we learned nothing from him. His lecture is from other professor, and it is extremely difficult to understand what he is saying in the lecture. I feel like all of the knowledge I got from this course is from self-learning.
The first assignment was unnecessarily difficult, after that they are doable and you actually learn something from them. The midterms are open book and difficult.

He seems to be a nice guy but is completely out of touch with his students. He has taken the complexity of all topics to the extreme and I feel as though my foundation of SQL is poor as difficulty went from 0-100 instantly. The first assignment we had to learn complex syntax that is completely useless as it is not used anywhere in the real world.
